alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:58AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kit Carson and west central Sherman Counties through 530 AM MDT... At 457 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Bethune, or 12 miles southwest of Burlington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burlington around 515 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kanorado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 429 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 174 and 194. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
